name: Ahivant Fort
description: Ahivant is a part of Ajanta mountain range. Ahivant and Achala, both are neighbours. On the north of Saptashringi and to the west of Dhodap fort, is situated this fort with a big plateau. Not very frequently visited by trekkerâ€™s, this fort has seen many battles in the history.

name: Raigad Fort
description: Raigad Fort, linked to Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj, is a remarkable hill fort located in Mahad, Raigad District, Maharashtra. It stands out as one of the most robust fortresses in the Deccan Plateau and is renowned globally as the 'Gibraltar of the East.' Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj played a significant role in developing various structures and constructions in Raigad.

name: Achala Fort
description: Achala Fort is the furthest west fort in the Satmala hill range, situated about 55 kilometers from Nashik in Maharashtra. It is right next to Ahivant Fort, and both of them, along with Mohandar Fort, are closely connected. The purpose of Achala and Mohandar forts was to protect Ahivant Fort. Captain Briggs described Achala Fort as a big hill that's easy to climb until you reach the top, where it becomes very steep.

name: Agashi Fort
description: Agashi Fort is one of the 350 forts in Maharashtra, located in the Konkan region, specifically in Agashi village. The fort got its name from the village itself. Unfortunately, it is in a state of complete ruin now. According to local beliefs, the fort existed during the rule of King Bimb and has a rich historical past.

name: Ahmadnagar Fort
description: Ahmednagar Fort also known as Kot Bagh Nizam is one of the oldest forts of India. Built in the 16th century, the fort standing for over 400 years now, is having the most enticing history of all times. It was the Royal residence and Administrative Centre of Nizam Shahi Dynasty from 1490 AD.

name: Ajinkyatara Fort
description: Ajinkyatara is an old fort on a mountain near Satara city in Maharashtra, India. It was built in the 16th Century and now has a TV tower for Satara. Many important events in Maratha history happened at this fort.

name: Akola Fort
description: A long time ago, a man named Akol Singh built Akola Fort in Akola district. He made the fort out of mud during the time when Aurangzeb was in charge. Legend has it that Akol Singh was inspired to build the fort when he saw a hare chasing a dog, thinking it was a good sign. So, he decided to construct a fort around the village.

name: Akluj Fort
description: Akluj has a significant role in Marathi history. It has witnessed numerous battles, campaigns, and important events involving Aurangzeb, Sambhaji Raje, and the Peshwas. The Nira River served as the boundary between the Nizamshahi dynasty of Ahmednagar and the Adilshahi dynasty of Bijapur. Emperor Aurangzeb even crossed the river by boat during his travels.

name: Alang Fort
description: Alang Fort or Alangad is a fort in Nashik, Maharashtra, India. It is one of the most difficult forts to reach in Nashik. The other two forts are Madangad and Kulang. It is among the tourist places that people visit for hoilidays.

name: Anjaneri Fort
description: Anjaneri fort trek is one of the famous treks in Nasik-Triambakeshwar mountain range of Maharashtra. It is an attraction of Nashik city and Triambakeshwar region
